alert.note: Alert for Orange; Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 11:23AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Seminole and northwestern Orange Counties through NOON EDT... At 1122 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Altamonte Springs, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Orlando, Apopka, Altamonte Springs, Oviedo, and Winter Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EDT for east central Florida.
